result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie H Glinberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA surharge during period of probation. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
Obtain and maintain full time employment, school or combination of both.

Not to possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
No contact with Katherine H. or parents Scott and Melissa H.
No firearms or weapons.

Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Restitution set at zero.
Particpate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jamie H Glinberg in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 (three) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of
 9 months: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
    *   Mental Health Evaluation - Grief Counseling.  
    *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or.
          combination of both.
     *   No contact with Katherine H. or parents Scott and Melissa H.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA surcharge)
          during the period of probation.
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due 
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
    *   Restitution is set at $0 (zero).
    *   No firearms or weapons.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; received and filed.
Court advised defendant that the no contact order with Nicholas B. is sticken and all other conditions remain in effect.

Defendant Jamie H Glinberg in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  State needs additional time to comply with victim notification.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  COURT RETAINED COURT FILE. Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jamie H Glinberg in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel needs additional time to get offer from issuing ADA, discovery received.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Katherine H.; Scott H.; Melissa H. or Niholas B.

Defendant Jamie H Glinberg in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Defendant Jamie H Glinberg in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
